title: [K-12] Mastering Differential Equations: Advanced Modeling for Social Problem Solving

context.prior_knowledge: Knowledge of algebra, trigonometry, and introductory calculus
context.additional_context: A course focusing on differential equation modeling for analyzing social phenomena, combining theory learning with digital devices and offline project-based collaborative activities.

learning_goals: Learners model real-world social issues (e.g., population growth, epidemic spread) with differential equations and solve them using numerical analysis techniques
The system for predicting social data can be constructed by applying analytical solution methods for first- and second-order differential equations
A project report analyzing economic fluctuation phenomena can be prepared using advanced techniques such as Laplace transforms
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
